channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Four travel gems in France: A guide through lavender fields, sleepy ski villages, and the region’s ‘Hamptons’
item.description: The following four regions are no secret; the French, and some smart Brits, have long understood their appeal.

item.title: Thousands of Disneyland workers vote to authorize a strike
item.description: The employees at the center of the labor fight include custodians, ride operators, candymakers and merchandise clerks at the theme park and resort complex.

item.title: Is this American Express card worth the $695 fee? Yes — if you’re in this group.
Affordable travel is to blame for Europe’s overtourism problem, spoiling its most sought-after cities like Barcelona, Amsterdam and Athens
item.description: Mass tourism isn't a new phenomenon, but it’s reached a tipping point in Europe where locals are increasingly bearing the brunt of it.

item.title: Rep. Sheila Jackson Lee dies after battle with cancer
item.description: The Texas Democrat announced in June that she had been diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and was undergoing treatment.

item.title: Activist investor Elliott has built a big stake in Starbucks, WSJ reports
CEO at cybersecurity firm that caused a global outage forgot to apologize
item.description: The lack of contrition likely stems from the IT sector’s longstanding struggle to relate in a more personalized and less robotic way with the general public.

item.title: AOC rallies to Biden's side as progressives split over backing his 2024 campaign
item.description: The New York progressive has emerged as an unexpected voice speaking out against the Democratic “donors” and “elites” she says are trying to push the president out.

item.title: How to get refunds for delayed or cancelled flights after the CrowdStrike outage
Billionaire’s son resolves feud over inheritance
item.description: Alberto Safra claimed his father, who suffered from Parkinson’s disease, lacked the mental capacity to execute the three new wills that disinherited him

item.title: Trump ally Allen Weisselberg released from jail
item.description: Weisselberg, the former chief financial officer of the Trump Organization, was sentenced in April to five months behind bars after he pleaded guilty to two counts of perjury.

item.title: A Trump presidency could ‘rock’ the EV market — and bring Tesla prices way down
Apple and Walmart banking partner Green Dot fined $44 million by the Federal Reserve
item.description: Green Dot Bank, the banking-as-a-Service partner to some of America’s biggest companies agreed to pay the fine for policies they say they fixed years ago.

item.title: VP Harris and Democratic donors discuss 'emerging needs' with Biden campaign in crisis
item.description: If Biden were to drop out of the race, many see Harris as the likeliest replacement at the top of the Democratic ticket.

item.title: Robinhood lost $2 million to scam artists with names like ‘Ghost’ and ‘Payday'
